Context:
Program Name: Pre-Business
Code: A146
Credential: Ontario College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 1 year (2 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $3,772.00
International Tuition: $17,479.00
Program Location: St. James Campus
Delivery Mode: Hybrid (Fall 2023 - Semester 1 and Winter 2024 - Semesters 1 and 2)
Program Type: Preparatory & Liberal Studies
School: Work & College Preparation
Centre: Centre for Business
Program Availability: Fall 2023 (Closed for domestic and international students), Winter 2024 (Closed for domestic and international students), Spring 2024 (Not Available)
Related Programs: International Business Management (Postgraduate) (B411), Human Resources Management (Postgraduate) (B408)

The Pre-Business program at George Brown College starts in September and January. It provides a foundation in marketing, math, accounting, English, and other core business subjects. Upon graduation, students are eligible for advanced standing to several George Brown Centre for Business diploma and advanced diploma programs. Course credits are transferable to diploma programs at other post-secondary institutions. The program offers dedicated teachers and student supports including career and academic advising.

The Pre-Business program can prepare students academically for entry into two-year Business diploma programs and three-year Business advanced diploma programs in just two semesters. Graduates may be exempted from certain Business courses, depending on the grade level achieved. The required courses for Semester 1 include COMP 1010 - Business Computer Applications I, BUS 1047 - Business Essentials I, MARK 1035 - Marketing Essentials I, MATH 1027 - Business Math with Remediation, COMM 1000 - Introduction to College Communication, COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts, and PREP 1012 - Personal and Professional Development. Semester 2 courses include BUS 1049 - Business Essentials II, MARK 1036 - Marketing Essentials II, ACCT 1036 - Principles of Accounting, PREP 1025 - Speaking with Confidence, MATH 1008 - Mathematics for Business and Management I, COMM 2000 - Communicating Across Contexts, and a General Education Elective (GNED).

Graduates of the Pre-Business program can apply for admission into Semester 2 of select George Brown College Centre for Business diploma programs. The School of Work and College Preparation provides access to a Pathway Advisor who helps with upgrading options, pre-programs, and articulation agreements, facilitating the transition into further post-secondary programs.

Program Learning Outcomes:
1. Examine the impact of economic variables, legislation, ethics, technology, and the environment on an organization's operations.

The text provides information about a college program that covers various topics including economic variables, accounting and financial concepts, marketing concepts, computer skills, personal development, business language, time management, research skills, tuition fees, and admission requirements.

Tuition Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $3,772.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2022)
- International Tuition: $17,479.00 for the first two semesters (Fall 2023)

Financial Assistance:
- The program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants need an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent, a grade 12 English credit (C or U), or Mature Student Status and may take the Admissions Assessment for English or upgrade to achieve the credit.

* Applicants can take the Admissions Assessment for English or consider upgrading to achieve required credits in English.
* George Brown College is committed to ensuring applicants succeed in their chosen program and meeting minimum requirements does not guarantee admission.
* Course exemptions may be granted based on college or university credits. More information can be found on the transfer guide.
* International students should refer to the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
* Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges, while international students should apply through George Brown College Online Application System.
* Contact Pathway Advisor at 416-415-5000, ext. 2562 or email preparation@georgebrown.ca for more information about college preparation and work preparation programs.
* Visit the Contact Us page to contact George Brown College, or visit the International Contact Us page to contact international recruitment representatives.
* Pre-Business program is taught at St. James Campus at 341 King St. E., Toronto, Ontario. Register for an information session, book a campus tour, or explore the virtual tour.
* Related programs include International Business Management (Postgraduate) and Human Resources Management (Postgraduate).
* Quote from Lacey Fontaine about her experience with Pre-Business program.
